    public abstract class Peer
extends BasicAgent
    Behaviour of all peers, both Ordinary and Super

      • addKnownPeers

        public void addKnownPeers(java.lang.String peers)
        Adds a semicolon delimited list of local Super Peer names to the knownPeers list. Only adds peers which are not already known to this peer.
        Parameters:
        peers - List of peers

      • hasRequestedPeers

        public boolean hasRequestedPeers()
        Whether or not the Peer has requested peers from the Host Cache/

      • setRequestedPeers

        public void setRequestedPeers(boolean requestedPeers)
        Set to true when sending a Request Neighbours, and false when we get a response.

        Returns:
        True if knownPeers contains an element, false otherwise.

      • needsKnownPeers

        public boolean needsKnownPeers()
        Returns:
        true if we still need a connection, and there are no Peers left to ask

      • needsConnectedPeers

        public boolean needsConnectedPeers()
        Setting a MAX prevents the peer from spamming connect requests
        Returns:
        true if the peer's number of connected peers is below the minimum.

      • receiveFile

        public void receiveFile(java.lang.String file)

      • closestConnectedPeer

        public jade.core.AID closestConnectedPeer(java.lang.String file)
        'Closest' as defined by the document routing procedure. The universal set of AIDs have total ordering. This allows us to implement Document Routing, where the chosen destination for a forwarded message is to the peer with an ID that's adjacent to the AID of the file. Strictly speaking the file AID should be generated when the file is published - since we informally require files to have unique local names, we can safely generate the AID dynamically.
        Parameters:
        file - File to match against the list of peers; the target.
        Returns:
        ID of the peer with an AID closest to the file AID

      • getSharedFiles

        public java.lang.String getSharedFiles()
        Returns:
        semicolon delimited list of shared filed for this peer
